3) Under 'All Activity', note that commit activity has occurred recently.
4) Click on the 'Source' tab, and delve into the project in question.
5) Under 'All Activity', note that commit activity has occurred recently, as seen in step #3.
4) Go back to the dashboard.
5) Note that 'All Activity' does not show any activity.

Also, no commits are shown under the "Commits" tab.

fields.description:
My team is using Bazaar as a local client with a Subversion server.  The Subversion server is monitored by Fisheye.  We do commits locally using Bazaar and push these up to the subversion server.  

The problem occurs because bazaar decorates the revisions it pushes up to subversion with properties, some of them quite lengthy (see screenshot).  When this happens the part of the GUI that should show the diff is no longer visible.  This unified diff is great to do a quick review of the commit.

Maybe the properties box could be collapsible or something scrollable to be able to view both the properties and the diff?
fields.summary: Too many svn properties causes diffs to disappear

fields.description:

The dashboard mostly needs between 10 and 15 seconds to render). This is very annoying especially as this is the homepage which most of our users do not need.

This affects extremly the acceptance of this tool :-(

As a workaround a switch to the browse-page as homepage would be sufficient for the moment - unfortunately this is not configurable (or did I miss something?)
fields.summary: Dashboard is extremely slow

fields.description:
It's really easy to see unmapped committers in a repository. But adding a mapping requires going to the user preference or admin screen, remembering the committer name and making the mapping.

But we have committer hovers! Why not add a one click 'map to me' tool on the hover to add mappings? Instead of a bazillion clicks it could be 1!
fields.summary: Allow unmapped committers to be mapped to users from the committer hover.

fields.description:
If a user is mapped to several committers in the same repository, the file annotations page - graphs, legend and annotation - will show the same user as different colours as they are different committers. This looks really stupid as we list the mapped user, not the committer.

As we see more DCVS adoption I believe this issue will arise more, as people easily fail to update hgrcs etc and end up with many committers mapped to the same user in the same rep with edits to the same file.
fields.summary: File annotation page graphs & legend do not coalesce mapped committers

fields.description:
Just as a background - we have essentially stopped using FishEye due to the UI changes between 1.5 -> 2.1.4 - after heavily used FishEye for every day before, this is really a bit painful. So let's start with the major issue:

The list of commits that has been done now uses way to much space vertically, making it impossible to see more than a few commits.

I've attached a screenshot outlining all the dead space in a typical layout - I'd really expect to be able to see at least 25-30 commits in that space, rather than 7 (!) which is all that fits now. With the previous UI, it was possible to see a lot more at a glance, avoiding continuous scrolling.

I don't advocate reverting to the old UI, but some way of displaying more data 'on the same line' and to compact the display significantly is really needed - the content here are the commits, 'content is king' - let the 'king' rule ;-)

I've been using FishEye to get a good sense of 'what has recently been changed and by whom', this requires to be ablet to scan a fair number of recent commits without using the scrollbar...

I'm attaching a second (very ugly, sorry) screenshot with one possible suggestion on how compact the layout significantly by putting things on one line and moving the 'modified X files' to the rightmost side instead.
fields.summary: FishEye UI for commits should be more compact
Excluding for example **/tags/**/tags/* from SVN repository does not work.

fields.description:
When viewing a file or directory in Fisheye, the "Watches" function on the top right part of the screen only shows when only certain sub-tabs are selected below.

For example, when you're viewing a directory in Fisheye the default view is the "Files" tab.  From this tab (and only this tab) you're able to select "Watch" from the tool menu.

However, for a file the default sub-tab that is selected is "Revisions".  You can't add a watch from here, you must click the "Activity" tab to do so.  I've attached screenshots of this.  It can be very confusing!

Since the tool menu is contextual for the given file or directory, why not have the Watch menu item be available no matter what sub-tab is selected?
fields.summary: Allow Watches from default File view screen

Thanks for reading. Love your products!
fields.summary: New Feature: SVN Commit Message Word Cloud

fields.description:
{quote}
We are doing what the SVN red book calls a complex tag which is simply multiple files at different revisions. The tags are a representation of a potentially shipping build. I do not believe that it is an uncommon method for larger development teams working on the same product. The reason we do complex tagging is because we do not stop development for everyone when there is a test failure in a build - people that do not have test failures are free to continue development and check in new code (however this bumps up the revision number - which is a singular entity). When we have test failures and get new code to fix the issue, we do not re-get everything - just the code that fixes the issue. Once we have everything working for a build, we check that in as a tag, but since it may contain multiple revisions, it is not what the red book calls a simple tag, but rather a complex tag.
{quote}

A complex tag will look like:

{noformat}
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r10000 | name | 2009-11-16 22:43:38 -0500 (Mon, 16 Nov 2009) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   A /tags/TAGNAME (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME:21836)
   R /tags/TAGNAME/Assemblys/Conversions/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME/Assemblys/Conversions/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs:21897)
   R /tags/TAGNAME/Assemblys/Conversions/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME/Assemblys/Conversions/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs:21897)
   R /tags/TAGNAME/Assemblys/Conversions/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME/Assemblys/Conversions/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs:21897)
   R /tags/TAGNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs:21897)
   R /tags/TAGNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath.Web/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath.Web/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs:21897)
   R /tags/TAGNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs:21897)
   R /tags/TAGNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs:21897)
   R /tags/TAGNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs:21897)
   R /tags/TAGNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs:21897)
   R /tags/TAGNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath.Forms/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs (from /trunk/PRODUCTNAME/Assemblys/Diagnostics/Somepath.Forms/Properties/AssemblyInfo.cs:21897)
...
{noformat}

Due to the way fisheye normally does not fetch diffs for tags (as fetching a diff for an entire tag is time consuming and the information is already in the index), fisheye will not fetch a tag for the entire changeset but instead fetch a tag for each of the files that are replaced as part of the complex tag. If the number of these files is large, the fetching of the diffs take longer, causing the index to take a much longer time, than those that tag as per a simple tag.
fields.summary: Fisheye has performance issues with indexing complex tags

fields.description:
An incorrect perforce configuration can lead to the following error: 

{noformat}Perforce Server Version: P4D/DARWIN80U/2009.2/249896 (2010/06/04)

Perforce Server Time: 2010/08/17 12:06:28 +1000 EST

Non-zero exit status determining latest revision: Unable to login: Command failed to execute - non-zero exit code: 1 - Fatal client error; disconnecting! EOF reading terminal.

Error testing connection.
com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException - Problem communicating with repository : Unable to determine latest revision. No revision information was returned - check path exists, permissions and output encoding
com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.client.P4ClientException - Unable to determine latest revision. No revision information was returned - check path exists, permissions and output encoding

Connection failed.
{noformat} 

The error message isn't very helpful, but it is thrown when you are using ticket based authentication and do not provide a password in the FishEye repository configuration. 

Executing the p4 commands in a terminal reveal: 

!http://img.skitch.com/20100817-xq9p6ktawaf1xmw1c28k9p6ghy.jpg!

fields.description:
There are stack traces in the log when you adding a Git repository in Fisheye:
{code:java}
2010-08-02 23:59:44,779 INFO [IncrementalPinger2] fisheye.app DvcsContext-dumpHandlerErrors - Exception executing command "git show-ref --tags " Non-zero exit code: 1
com.atlassian.fisheye.plugins.scm.utils.process.ProcessException: Non-zero exit code: 1
at com.atlassian.fisheye.plugins.scm.utils.process.PluggableProcessHandler.complete(PluggableProcessHandler.java:66)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.plugins.scm.utils.process.ExternalProcess.finish(ExternalProcess.java:204)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.plugins.scm.utils.process.ExternalProcess.execute(ExternalProcess.java:218)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.client.DvcsContext.executeCommand(DvcsContext.java:183)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.client.DvcsContext.executeCommand(DvcsContext.java:167)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.client.DvcsContext.executeCommand(DvcsContext.java:163)
{code}

The message is harmless and not an error. Basically, it means that when executing "git show-ref --tags" command it returns an exit code 1 when there are no tags. However, if we can improve the logging state, it can avoid a bunch of stack traces in the log and reduce the log size.

In the hgfelog python extension we offer both a short and long format. If you add {{verbose = true}} to the {{[ui]}} section of .hgrc mercurial will default to verbose output. e.g: 

{noformat}[amyers@erdinger:~]$ cat ~/.hgrc
[extensions] 
felog= ~/.hgextensions/hgfelog/hgfelog.py 

[ui]
verbose = true{noformat} 

FishEye will then blow up whenever it tries to scan a repo: 

{noformat}Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Match failed: string [Commit Id:     5215cd7abee844d1fc70907f3be2586504e7b645], pattern [C:([0-9a-fA-F]{40})]
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.hg.client.HgChangeParser.doProcessLine(HgChangeParser.java:192)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.handler.DvcsLineOutputHandler.processLine(DvcsLineOutputHandler.java:19)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.plugins.scm.utils.process.LineOutputHandler.process(LineOutputHandler.java:39)

        at com.atlassian.fisheye.plugins.scm.utils.process.ExternalProcess$4.doTask(ExternalProcess.java:166)
        ... 4 more{noformat} 

We only take into account the short format in HgChangeParser.

fields.description:
Morgan Stanley report that they are hitting several issues with lucene they think are causing performance issues with their instance. The following issues were fixed in lucene 2.9.3: 

{quote}Fixed memory leaks in IndexWriter when large documents are indexed. It also uses now shared memory pools for term vectors and stored fields. IndexWriter now releases Fieldables and Readers on close.
NativeFSLockFactory fixes and improvements. Release write lock if exception occurs in IndexWriter ctors.
An increased maximum number of unique terms in each index segment.
Important fixes to IndexWriter: a commit() thread-safety issue, lost document deletes in near real-time indexing{quote}

We should look at upgrading lucene.
fields.summary: Upgrade Lucene from 2.9.1

fields.description:
Fisheye handles viewing of invalid CVS changsets differently depending on the revision ID that is used.  For example, lets say that the following URL works for revision {{MAIN:cvs:20100709182838}}:

http://fisheye:8060/changelog/CVSTest/?cs=MAIN:cvs:20100709182838

Since the {{20100709182838}} is a timestamp, it is possible to increment/decrement the value of the timestamp by changing the URL.  So, for example if you update the URL to use the revision {{MAIN:cvs:20100709182837}} (one less than above), Fisheye will still return {{MAIN:cvs:20100709182838}}.  However, depending on the scenario it may also return a "Changeset not found page" (IMO is what would be expected, or in other cases it returns an error page with:

{noformat}
javax.el.PropertyNotFoundException: The class 'com.cenqua.fisheye.web.parameterbeans.ChangesetJspParams' does not have the property 'repname'.
The class 'com.cenqua.fisheye.web.parameterbeans.ChangesetJspParams' does not have the property 'repname'.
{noformat}

Users have reported that in previous Fisheye versions, it would automatically find the "closest" revision depending on the timestamp used in the revision URL.  This wasn't documented functionality, but I think it would be beneficial for our users to have some consistency.  Either provide an error message for any revision that doesn't exist (and handle the above error properly), or update the cache lookup so that the ability to find "closest" changesets is stable and perhaps document it for the future.

Note that this doesn't appear to be the case for other SCM's, for example viewing an invalid revision in SVN will always produce the "Changeset not found" error message.
fields.summary: Consistency when handling non-existent CVS changesets

fields.description:

My SVN repository lives behind an https domain, and supports either SSL or anonymous access via password authentication.  Even if I set the username to 'anonymous', Fisheye assumes I want to connect via SSL and blows up.  I am able to connect in Bamboo because I can specify to authenticate via Password.

After running Windows Update on Windows Server 2003 or 2008 with JDK 1.6.0_20, Fisheye using the Wrapper script is unable to start.  The following error message is given in {{wrapper.log}}:

{noformat}
STATUS | wrapper  | 2010/07/01 19:22:46 | Launching a JVM...
INFO   | jvm 4    | 2010/07/01 19:22:46 | Error occurred during initialization of VM
INFO   | jvm 4    | 2010/07/01 19:22:46 | Unable to load native library: The specified procedure could not be found
ERROR  | wrapper  | 2010/07/01 19:22:46 | JVM exited while loading the application.
{noformat}

On a test VM with Windows XP and JDK 1.6.0_20, Fisheye is able to start via a service without any issues.  It appears to be specific to Windows Server.  Users also mentioned that they've been able to use Fisheye with JDK 1.6.0_20, but the error only came about after the latest Windows Update.

At this point, the only workaround appears to be installing *JDK 1.6.0_16* and updating the {{wrapper.conf}} file to explicitly use the older JDK.  Please see [this|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Fisheye+Won't+Start+on+Windows+Server+with+JDK+1.6.0_20] Knowledge Base article.
fields.summary: Fisheye not compatible with JDK 1.6.0_20 on Windows Server 2003/2008

fields.description:
Currently there is no real way to get a Search output with all the lines containing a term in a search.

This would be very useful in the eyeSQL output or Search output to allow developers to quickly go through code to update changes.  For example, Company Name changes, Path changes etc, and confirm later it is all changed.
fields.summary: Allow EyeSQL to display line number search result (grep like)

fields.description:
A customer has requested that we update our documentation on how to start FishEye automatically on UNIX-based systems. He also points out that there's some variation in the way we document this across the products.

Tweets:
* http://twitter.com/craigmceldowney/statuses/17849222264
* http://twitter.com/craigmceldowney/statuses/17851410164

Please would you take a look at the FishEye documentation in this respect. I've found only one page, that concerns Mac OS X in particular:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/How+to+run+Fisheye+or+Crucible+on+startup+on+Mac+OS+X

For comparison, *Crowd* has the following documentation for the different OSes:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Installing+Crowd+as+a+Windows+Service
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Setting+Crowd+to+Start+Automatically+on+Mac+OS+X
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Setting+Crowd+to+Run+Automatically+and+Use+an+Unprivileged+System+User+on+UNIX

It would be worth looking at JIRA and Confluence too.
fields.summary: Please update documentation on how to start FishEye automatically on UNIX-based systems

fields.description:
FishEye/Crucible 2.2 onwards, scheduled backup directory could only be changed via /FISHEYE_INST/config.xml.
To do so, add <path>backup_directory</path> right after the <schedule...> element.

{noformat}
<backup><schedule enabled="true"><path>C:\backup</path><prefix>....
{noformat}

Kindly include the above info for
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Backing+Up+and+Restoring+Crucible+Data#BackingUpandRestoringCrucibleData-SchedulingCrucibleBackups
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Backing+Up+and+Restoring+FishEye+Data#BackingUpandRestoringFishEyeData-SchedulingFishEyeBackups
fields.summary: Update FishEye/Crucible backup page

fields.description:
Fisheye creates its own local copies of each user account and once a user is imported from an external source (say, Crowd), it is never updated again, unless the user gets deleted from crowd. This means, even after a manually triggered "resync", Crucible will not pick up on modified Firstname/Lastname attributes.

The problem is that [https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/src/java/com/cenqua/fisheye/user/DefaultUserManager.java?r=62671#l533] is never called with {{true}}.
fields.summary: DefaultUserManager never re-imports changed user details (Fullname) from an external source

fields.description:
Hi,

My installation of FishEye & Crucible is pointing to a subversion repository. I committed a changeset which added 2 files and modified numerous others. FishEye then picked up 1 file addition and the modifications but didn't pick up the other file addition. I then attempted to modify the file that wasn't picked up and see if it was found by FishEye in the next change set. FishEye doesn't even pick up this in the activity log.

Some basic settings for the repo are listed below
  SVN Path:  	
  Blocksize: 	(default)
  Svn Operation Timeout: 	(default)
  Throttle connections-per-sec: 	(not throttled)
  Charset: 	(default)
  Access Code     : 	none
  Start Revision     : 	not set
  Initial Import: 	Import without tag information
  Follow Base Moves: 	false
  Store Diff Info: 	true
Numerous excludes are used in the allow process.

If you require some logs or more information please let me know.

Thanks,
Marcus
fields.summary: FishEye not picking up items in a changeset

fields.description:
The allow process gives the ability to use includes and excludes for certain parts of your repository as described in the documentation here http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Allow+%28Process%29.
The exclude feature allows the use of wildcards, e.g. **/*.obj. As far as I can tell the include feature doesn't have the same option, i.e. include all of the branches that match a certain wildcard.
This functionality would be useful so I could include all branches that match /branches/componentx*. Currently I'm using a number of exclude wildcards which involves numerous different excludes.
fields.summary: Wildcard for include in allow process
